channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Simon Stix - Portfolio

item.title: Bruckner Tower VR showcase
item.description:
A VR panoramic view of the then-unfinished Bruckner Tower in Linz.

The application made it possible to see the view of apartments on different sides and heights of the tower.

item.title: DirectX 11 Grass Shader
item.description: A high-end DirectX 11 shader for Unity. It can render realistic and stylized grass.

item.title: Node-based shader editor
item.description:
A canceled shader editor that was originally meant to be published on the Unity asset store.

The editor supported custom nodes and output types with the help of C# reflection.

item.title: Second hand store administration software
item.description: A WPF based administration software for a second hand store in Linz.

item.title: Tile Composer
item.description:
A procedural content generation asset with a focus on usability.

Internally, it uses constraint solvers to fit tiles together on a grid while following constraints created by the user.

item.title: TourVR
item.description:
A bachelor thesis project for visualizing flight and hiking routes in mobile VR.

It was optimized to support a view distance of over 100km on a mobile phone, to make mountain ranges in the distance visible.

item.title: Unannounced indie game
item.description:
An unannounced multiplayer game project I have been working on as a solo dev with Unity as a renderer and a Rust backend.

A big part of this project was creating tools to simplify development for myself. This includes custom scripting languages, code generators, and lots of editor UI.
